channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for MS
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for MS

item.title: Report X-2023111123
item.description:
Report X-2023111123

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: OLIVE BRANCH
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was brought to QA already damaged and leaking by a hub IC tug driver. DescribePack: The upper part of the box was leaking from the internal packages. The caps on the inner bottles were cracked and bent. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Improper handling on the Hub's part so I immediately placed the package into a yellow drum to prevent further spillage.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: The package was in a trailer on A316 wet. One cap was slightly loose, causing internal leakage. DescribePack: Product cap was loosened. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Absorbent granules were used for the spill. and package was placed in plastic bag.

item.title: Report I-2023090142
item.description:
Report I-2023090142

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T00:34:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-23
  • City: RICHLAND
  • State: MS
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: THE KANSAS CITY SOUTHERN RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 0525 on 8/23/23, the Kansas City Southern Railway's (OBA CPKCR) Jackson, MS rail yard reported tank car WCHX 29218 leaking from the top of the car. The Environmental & Hazmat Department mobilized a railroad qualified response contractor to mitigate the release. Upon arrival, responders found that the dome lid on WCHX 29218 was tool tight. The car was vented, and then the dome lid was opened. Responders found no manway gasket Installed. A new gasket was installed, and then the manway dome lid was closed and tightened tool tight Responders then remediated the spillage on top and sides of the rail car. No product was released on the ground. Estimated release was 3 gallons. Once secure, the car was released back Into transportation. File Note: Item 19-the quantity released was estimated based on the best information available at the time of filing. This shipment was offered as a 'bulk' shipment, aka one car load, therefore the exact amount offered in this package is not known to the carrier. This carrier does not have access to mass balance data which can exactly quantify this value.
